review: I'm an avid Apple fan and have had two generations of Apple TV for some time now.  Last night was my first experience with my new Amazon Fire TV.  I was skeptical when I first received and turned it on, but pleasantly surprised.  It's so much faster than my Apple TV.  I use Netflix and Hulu Plus on Apple TV and they run so much quicker and smoother on the Fire TV.  Plus with Prime Instant Video, I get so much more content (and yeah, there are some duplicates between it and Netflix but all the other benefits of Prime make it worth it even without the video).  I hesitated at first in buying the device because of some of the reviews about browsing Prime Instant Videos, but I noticed that Amazon posted a firmware update to resolve that and it won me over.  So far, no complaints from me.  This is a solid piece of equipment, it's fast, it's loaded with good stuff and if you want to zone out and play some games - it has that too.

review: This is the kind of device I've been waiting for my outdoor TV. I play Amazon inside the house through my PS3 and PS4...but I needed a compact WIFI device to go behind my outdoor TV. One of the cool features I love is that if the TV is on a different output and I hit the home button on the Fire remote, the TV automatically changes to the input carrying the Fire TV. I did not have to program anything.
author: J. Cossio

review: I bought this to use on the TV in my home office, we already have a Roku 3 and I wanted to see how the Amazon Fire TV compared. On the positive side, the Fire TV remote control is much sturdier and better designed than the remote that comes with the Roku 3. The Fire TV itself is a nice solid piece of hardware, and since I have Prime it also came configured to access my amazon account. On the negative side, unless you primarily stream from amazon, the Fire TV interface is difficult to navigate and doesn't allow the user to organize installed streaming apps to suit individual taste. I will probably sell the Fire TV and buy another Roku 3.

review: With the exception of app selection, this device is far and away the best on the market.
